intro: Rollinia intermedia, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Caricaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The fruit, which is typically pear-shaped, has a thick, leathery skin and a sweet, aromatic pulp. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit and ornamental value. The plant thrives in humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
